Executive Summary

Perdue Foods, LLC DBA Draper Valley Farms (Mount Vernon Processing Facility) - Mount Vernon, WA

RMP 2017



* Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Perdue has developed and implemented a spill prevention control & countermeasure (SPCC) plan, emergency action plan (EAP) and process safety management (PSM) plan as part of the accidental release / emergency response program. The programs involve a wide-range of senior management personnel (including Environmental Manager and Safety Manager). Additionally, Perdue conducts regular safety meetings and training involving many levels of personnel. Perdue's policies and procedures are outlined in the respective plans. Perdue's corporate policy is to inspect, maintain and operate equipment and facilities to prevent accidents, including release of hazardous materials; and to train employees in prevention, as well as to prepare them to respond rapidly and effectively should an accident occur.



* Stationary Sources and Regulated Substances Handled

1. Refrigeration (anhydrous ammonia)

Ammonia is used for refrigeration purposes. The facility operates a three-temperature, single- stage, anhydrous ammonia (R-717) refrigeration system in the processing area and a four- temperature, single-stage system in the remote recirculation room. The majority of the refrigeration components are located in the processing mechanical rooms with the exception of condensers   located   on   the   roof    and    piping    located    throughout    the    facility. The entire refrigeration system is a closed loop, liquid re-circulation system with a total system storage capacity of 19,500 pounds.



* General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

Perdue maintains a Process Safety Management (PSM) of Highly Hazardous Chemicals plan prepared in accordance with OSHA regulation 29 CFR 1910.119. Perdue also utilizes a preventative maintenance program for its system compone

nts. As part of this program, maintenance personnel inspect the refrigeration system operating parameters and monitoring system multiple times per shift with observations recorded.



* Five-year Accident History

There has been no incidents above reportable quantities of anhydrous ammonia at the facility.



* Emergency Response Program

Perdue has implemented a comprehensive Emergency Response Plan in accordance with the OSHA PSM regulations. The facility has a trained emergency response team that will respond in the event of a hazardous material release, fire or other emergency situation. The Emergency Response Plan contains specific information regarding Emergency Response organization and procedures, as well as incident notification, mitigation, and incident preparedness. In addition, Perdue's training program includes annual refreshers. Perdue has also developed an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) to address other emergency response related incidents such as bomb threats, spills or releases of hazardous materials, evacuation, and tornados or dangerous weather conditions.
